doc.str: Materials based on tangled nanotubes or nanofibres, preparation method thereof and use of same

A method of preparing a solid material based on tangled nanotubes and/or nanofibers, includes a step of growing carbon nanofibers and/or nanotubes with restraint in a contained reactor; and the materials thus obtained. The different uses of the materials are also disclosed.

Cheng et al., "Long Bundles of Aligned Carbon Nanofibers Obtained by Vertical Floating Catalyst Method," Materials Chem. and Phys., vol. 87, No. 2-3, pp. 241-245 (Oct. 15, 2004). cited by other . | Gulino et al., "C2H6 as an Active Carbon Source for a Large Scale Synthesis of Carbon Nanotubes by Chemical Vapour Deposition," Applied Catalysts A, vol. 279, No. 1-2, p. 89-97 (Jan. 28, 2005). cited by other.
CENTRE NATIONAL DE LA RECHERCHE SCIENTIFIQUE (C.N.R.S.) (PARIS, FR), UNIVERSITE LOUIS PASTEUR
